intro: Parathesis candolleana, commonly known as the candolleana parathesis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
